anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr6360 [Robert Louis Stevenson]`s Treasure Island, but featuring the characters in the form of animals instead; for example, the pirate Silver is illustrated as a wolf, whereas the main character Jim is changed into a rabbit. Note: This was supposed to be the first episode of Mushi Pro Land, a unique series of 60-minute animated programmes; it was also Japan`s first 60-minute animated TV programme. However, the series never materialised and only this episode was actually ever aired.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: black and white
tag.description: Some or all of this anime is in black and white, typical of older anime made before ~1960. Some modern anime may intentionally shift to black and white for certain scenes or episodes as an artistic effect.
